thread.title: It couldn't have been poison, says North Korea
thread.title_full: It couldn't have been poison, says North Korea

author: JO TIMBUONG
title: It couldn't have been poison, says North Korea
text:
47 PM It couldn't have been poison, says North Korea by jo timbuong 
KUALA LUMPUR: North Korean embassy officials have rubbished Malaysian police investigations into the death of Kim Jong-nam, saying it could not have been poison. 
North Korea is also asking for the release of the three suspects who have been detained so far, including its citizen Ri Jong Chol. 
"It has been 10 days since the incident happened, but Malaysian police have not found any evidence from the arrested suspects," the embassy said in a statement which was delivered by an unidentified official. 
The statement goes on to deny that the female suspects had "dabbed" poison on Jong-nam's face with their own hands despite police investigations claiming that they had done so. 
More to come
